text: Wilson-Vines House, also known as the Roby Vines House, is a historic home located near Beaver Dam, Watauga County, North Carolina. It was built about 1895, and is a 2 1/2-story, L-plan, Queen Anne style frame dwelling. It rests on a stone foundation and is sheathed in clapboard and German siding. The front facade features a two-story, two-piered, 3/4 width porch with decorative sawnwork. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Queen Anne architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1917 Category:Houses in Watauga County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Watauga County, North Carolina
title: Wilson-Vines House
